title: 109_hr3988
content:
The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" gives priority to businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. Small businesses in these areas must receive a minimum percentage of contracts for goods and services. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that a minimum percentage of contracts for goods and services be awarded to small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Federal departments must ensure compliance with subcontracting goals for small businesses and provide maximum opportunities for their participation. Additionally, a report on small business opportunities must be submitted to Congress within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress within 2 years of the Act's enactment, detailing opportunities for small businesses. This subsection will end one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses will be treated as HUBZone businesses under the Small Business Act. This applies during the period of a Federal Disaster Declaration for the county where the business is located. SEC. 4. Federal facilities in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas cannot be permanently relocated. No federal facility in a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area can be permanently relocated outside that area. This prohibition will last for two years from the enactment of this Act. Reports must be submitted every 6 months on the status of any facility temporarily relocated for longer than 6 months. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS.

(a) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Small Business Concern: Refers to a small business in a Gulf hurricane-affected area as of August 28, 2005.
(b) Gulf Hurricane Disaster: Event caused by Hurricane Katrina or Rita declared a major disaster by the President.
(c) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Area: County or parish in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita.
(d) Small Business Concern: Defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act.

SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act will be effective 10 days after its enactment.
